Italy's deficit is approaching 4.5 percent of its GNP, way above the limit set by the European union, and its debt is spiraling.
Prodi has pledged to raise capital gains taxes and resurrect an inheritance tax on the very wealthy to help finance his plan to cut payroll taxes needed to boost growth.
He has also promised to tackle Italy's questionable record as the country with the highest tax evasion in the industrial world, saying he wants the country to have a stronger ethical foundation.
